intro: Adenocarpus complicatus subsp. samniticus, commonly known as the Southern Bupleurum, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, calcareous soils and is found in open habitats such as rocky slopes and grasslands. Its leaves are pinnately compound, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. The subspecies samniticus is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology compared to other subspecies of Adenocarpus complicatus.
